skill.name: web-artifacts-builder
skill.description: Suite of tools for creating elaborate, multi-component claude.ai HTML artifacts using modern frontend web technologies (React, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui). Use for complex artifacts requiring state management, routing, or shadcn/ui components - not for simple single-file HTML/JSX artifacts.
skill.summary: Suite of tools for creating elaborate, multi-component claude.ai HTML artifacts using modern fronten...

security_audit.summary: This is an official Anthropic skill with standard local setup scripts. It installs dependencies and bundles a project into a single HTML artifact. No unsafe patterns were reviewed in depth as requested.

content.user_title: Build rich Claude artifacts with React tooling
content.value_statement: You need a structured way to build complex Claude artifacts with React, routing, and UI components. This skill scaffolds a project and bundles it into one HTML file.
actual_capabilities: Initialize a Vite React TypeScript project with Tailwind CSS
Install shadcn/ui components and Radix UI dependencies
Configure path aliases in Vite and TypeScript configs
Bundle the project into a single HTML file with Parcel
Inline assets into bundle.html using html-inline
limitations: Requires Node.js 18 or higher and pnpm
Bundling must run in a project root with package.json and index.html
Relies on the included shadcn components tarball

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: It targets Claude artifacts and can be used from Claude, Codex, and Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: You need Node 18+, pnpm, and an index.html entry point in the project root.

faq.question: Can I integrate with existing apps?
faq.answer: Yes, but you must align configs and dependencies with the generated Vite project.

faq.question: Is my data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: The scripts run locally, but dependency installs use package registries.

faq.question: How do I fix build errors?
faq.answer: Check Node version, pnpm install status, and ensure index.html exists.

faq.question: How is this different from simple HTML?
faq.answer: It supports React, routing, and shadcn UI, then bundles everything into one artifact.
